intro: Cylindrocarpa, commonly known as the Australian native fig, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Moraceae. It is characterized by its unique, fleshy, edible fruits that are often consumed by birds and small mammals. The plants typically have smooth, cylindrical stems and are found in various habitats across Australia. They are shrubs or small trees, often with dark green, lance-shaped leaves. Cylindrocarpa species are well adapted to dry and arid environments, making them resilient to drought conditions.
